alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 6:58PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties through 630 PM MDT/730 PM CDT/... At 557 PM MDT/657 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Wallace, or 18 miles northeast of Sharon Springs, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Wallace and northwestern Logan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
